title: Augmented Reality (AR)-Based Instructional Design for Understanding Real-Life Chemistry Concepts

context.additional_context: A blended learning structure combining online theoretical lectures with AR-based offline practice, enhancing conceptual understanding by visualizing chemical phenomena encountered in daily life through AR technology

learning_goals: Students can observe and explain everyday chemical reactions (e.g., oxidation, neutralization) in 3D using AR apps
Learners can analyze the structure-property relationships of chemical substances through AR simulations and present real-world application examples
Students can document and evaluate AR-based chemical problem-solving processes through collaborative learning

resources: AR Marker Set and Experiment Kit
Offline Practical Space (Chemistry Lab or Smart Classroom)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
